content: Singaporean cabinet position The **Minister-in-charge of Muslim Affairs** is a special appointment in the [Cabinet of Singapore](/wiki/Cabinet_of_Singapore) that oversees policies and issues related to the [Muslim](/wiki/Islam_in_Singapore) community in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). Established in 1977, all officeholders has been a part of said community and the minister also oversees the [Administration of Muslim Law Act](/wiki/Administration_of_Muslim_Law_Act). The incumbent minister is [Muhammad Faishal Ibrahim](/wiki/Muhammad_Faishal_Ibrahim) of the [People's Action Party](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) (PAP). ## Responsibilities The Minister-in-charge of Muslim Affairs recommends members to be appointed onto [Majlis Ugama Islam Singapura](/wiki/Majlis_Ugama_Islam_Singapura)'s (MUIS) executive council. Under the [Administration of Muslim Law Act](/wiki/Administration_of_Muslim_Law_Act), the Minister also ensures that laws which are relevant to Muslims in Singapore are applied properly.
